gobblin.runtime.api

Interface JobExecutionDriver

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Future<JobExecutionResult>, JobExecutionStateListenerContainer, ListenableFuture<JobExecutionResult>, Runnable, RunnableFuture<JobExecutionResult>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JobLauncherExecutionDriver

    public interface JobExecutionDriver
extends JobExecutionStateListenerContainer, ListenableFuture<JobExecutionResult>, RunnableFuture<JobExecutionResult>
    Defines an implementation which knows how to run a GobblinJob and keep track of the progress.

    The class utilizes the Service interface.

    • Service.startAsync() starts the execution.
    • Service.stopAsync() cancels the execution if running; if the job has completed, it is a NO-OP
    • Service.awaitTerminated(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) - waits for the job to complete or get canceled.
